author: alenokia
post_text: April 15, 2015 at 9:58 PM#1its possible add 2 or more variables to another one? eg:setuservar $aa=1setuservar $bb=0setuservar $cc=3setuservar $vv=$"aa"; adduservar $vv=$"bb"; adduservar $vv=$"cc"-or-setuservar $vv=$"aa"$"bb"$"cc"my result  with adduservar is $vv=4.... not "103".... some idea?Thanks...ALe...

posts.author: alenokia
posts.post_text: April 15, 2015 at 9:58 PM#1its possible add 2 or more variables to another one? eg:setuservar $aa=1setuservar $bb=0setuservar $cc=3setuservar $vv=$"aa"; adduservar $vv=$"bb"; adduservar $vv=$"cc"-or-setuservar $vv=$"aa"$"bb"$"cc"my result  with adduservar is $vv=4.... not "103".... some idea?Thanks...ALe...

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: April 15, 2015 at 10:30 PM#2for what purpose will you use $vv?you will need to initiate $vv as a string (non-numerical characters) if you want concat of text rather than mathematical additione.g.setuservar $vv="Group "; adduservar $vv=$"aa"; adduservar $vv=$"bb"; adduservar $vv=$"cc"$vv -> "Group 103"

posts.author: alenokia
posts.post_text: April 15, 2015 at 10:42 PM#3well ... $ AA would be the hundred, $ BB's dozen, $ CC unit to form a numbering to sequences and groups.instead of $ VV can be within the same variable $ AAadduservar $aa=$"bb"; adduservar $aa=$"cc"to be used to  ... store seq $aa

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: April 15, 2015 at 11:07 PM#4I believe this should work:Codesetuservar $mygroup="Group "adduservar $mygroup=$"aa"adduservar $mygroup=$"bb"adduservar $mygroup=$"cc"setuservar $myseq="Sequence "adduservar $myseq=$"aa"adduservar $myseq=$"bb"adduservar $myseq=$"cc"Store $mygroup->Store Group 103Store $myseq->Store Sequence 103Display Moreor merely useCodeStore Sequence $aa$bb$ccStore Group $aa$bb$cc

posts.author: alenokia
posts.post_text: April 16, 2015 at 3:51 PM#5thank you very much ... I found a workarraund to do it, based on your data.=D

posts.author: alenokia
posts.post_text: May 7, 2015 at 3:33 AM#7this is my solution...SetUserVar $Gnxx= 1     //this defines the hundred via another macroSetUserVar $Gxnn=01    //this defines the unit via another macroSetUserVar $Snnn=100;  AddUserVar $Snnn = $GnxxSetUserVar $ttt="D_";  AddUserVar $ttt=$Gnxx;  AddUserVar $ttt=$GxnnGroup $Gnxx$GxnnAt Effect 1Store /o  Sequence $Snnn  Cue 1Label Sequence $Snnn $"ttt"ENJOY!!!  =)

title: Add 2 user var to other
